this is our lecture number 11 if we will see what we have covered in the in our previous classes so you can see that in our previous classes or basically if I will talk about the last class which we have studied in this we have studied about the Sugino inference system and we have seen one numerical on the which is based on that Sugino inference system so what we have learned about the Sugino inference system how their rules looks alike like if we see the structure of the rules for the Sugino inference system that is if x is a and y is b then z should be a linear function of something means it is a mathematical equation instead of if we compared it with the Mamdani inference system then in their output is also a membership function but in the case of Sugino inference system the output is a mathematical function or their output is their output directly give us a crisp value we don't have to convert that answer to some other form or basically like in the case of Mamdani inference system when which we are again in which we are again converting the output to the crisp output with the help of a process named defuzzification but in the case of Sugino fuzzy inference system it doesn't need it it directly gives you a crisp output so there is no need for defuzzification we can we will use instead of that a weighted average weighted average method basically now what's the advantage of Sugino inference system basically which we have seen that it is a fast and efficient for the real time controlling if we want to apply in application in which real time controlling is needed then we can apply the Sugino inference system for that because it is fast and efficient for that types of system and it is also suitable for the adaptive and optimization based system in which optimized approach is needed you can apply Sugino inference system for that application.
